title: Trapdoor spider
data:

*For a list of all arthropods, see [list of arthropods](/List_of_arthropods "List of arthropods").*

| trapdoor spider s [![Trapdoor spider.png](/images/3/36/Trapdoor_spider.png)](/File:Trapdoor_spider.png) |                                                                                                                                                       |

| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A fast-moving arachnid that both surprises its prey and evades its enemies by concealing itself in crannies in the dungeon floor. |

## Useful Info

**Trapdoor spiders** are territorial monsters that are normally content to [hide](/Submerges "Submerges") underground. However, if you step adjacent to their tile, they will leap out and attack. They are somewhat fragile, but fast and [poisonous](/Poison "Poison"), and the fact that you can only find them by walking into melee range makes escape very challenging. They can occasionally be found in [the Dungeon](/The_Dungeon "The Dungeon") and in [Labyrinths](/Labyrinth "Labyrinth"), but are much more commonly found throughout the [Spider's Nest](/Spider%27s_Nest "Spider's Nest").

## Tips & Tricks

- [Ensorcelled Hibernation](/Ensorcelled_Hibernation "Ensorcelled Hibernation") does not work as well as you might hope against these; once put to sleep, they immediately burrow back underground. [Mephitic Cloud](/Mephitic_Cloud "Mephitic Cloud")-confused spiders, on the other hand, are incapable of escaping in that manner.
- [Ignite Poison](/Ignite_Poison "Ignite Poison") can hurt them even when they're underground.

## History

Trapdoor spiders were removed in [0.18](/0.18 "0.18").
html:
Trapdoor spider

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.

For a list of all arthropods, see list of arthropods.

trapdoor spider s

 

HP 24-56
HD 8
XP 225
Speed 15
AC 3
EV 10
MR 20
Attack1 20 (bite: poison)


Max Chunks 2
Type of Meat Inedible
Resistances None
Vulnerabilities Poison
Habitat Land
Intelligence Brainless
Uses Uses nothing
Holiness Natural
Size Little
Type spider, trapdoor spider
Flags Web sense
Submerges
No skeleton
Web sense
A fast-moving arachnid that both surprises its prey and evades its enemies by concealing itself in crannies in the dungeon floor.


Useful Info

Trapdoor spiders are territorial monsters that are normally content to hide underground. However, if you step adjacent to their tile, they will leap out and attack. They are somewhat fragile, but fast and poisonous, and the fact that you can only find them by walking into melee range makes escape very challenging. They can occasionally be found in the Dungeon and in Labyrinths, but are much more commonly found throughout the Spider's Nest.

Tips & Tricks

  • Ensorcelled Hibernation does not work as well as you might hope against these; once put to sleep, they immediately burrow back underground. Mephitic Cloud-confused spiders, on the other hand, are incapable of escaping in that manner.
  • Ignite Poison can hurt them even when they're underground.

History

Trapdoor spiders were removed in 0.18.

However, if you step adjacent to their tile, they will leap out and attack. They are somewhat fragile, but fast and [[poison]]ous, and the fact that you can only find them by walking into melee range makes escape very challenging. They can occasionally be found in [[the Dungeon]] and in [[Labyrinth]]s, but are much more commonly found throughout the [[Spider's Nest]]. ==Tips & Tricks== *[[Ensorcelled Hibernation]] does not work as well as you might hope against these; once put to sleep, they immediately burrow back underground. [[Mephitic Cloud]]-confused spiders, on the other hand, are incapable of escaping in that manner. *[[Ignite Poison]] can hurt them even when they're underground. ==History== Trapdoor spiders were removed in [[0.18]].
